meanings.definition: A reversion to an earlier ancestral characteristic.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the throwbacks in the DNA to understand the family history.
meanings.sent2: The vintage car was a throwback to the classic designs of the 1950s.
meanings.sent3: The throwbacks in the family reunion photos made everyone laugh at the old hairstyles.
meanings.sent4: Her love for black and white movies was a throwback to a simpler time.
meanings.sent5: The throwbacks in the museum exhibit brought the past to life for visitors.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that is similar to an earlier type or style.
meanings.sent1: The new restaurant was a throwback to the diners of the 1950s.
meanings.sent2: The vintage dress she wore was a perfect throwback to the fashion of the past.
meanings.sent3: His love for vinyl records made him a musical throwback in the digital age.
meanings.sent4: The old house was a charming throwback to a bygone era.
meanings.sent5: The retro furniture was a stylish throwback to mid-century design.

meanings.definition: To revert to an earlier type or form.
meanings.sent1: After the renovation, the building began to throwback to its original architecture.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to throwback to their traditional logo for the anniversary campaign.
meanings.sent3: The fashion designer chose to throwback to 80s trends in the new collection.
meanings.sent4: As the movie progressed, it started to throwback to classic Hollywood storytelling.
meanings.sent5: The song's melody seemed to throwback to a different musical era.
